items.title: Awesome Dotnet
items.content_text:
### ETL

*   [EtlBox.Classic (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/rpsft/etlbox) - Lightweight ETL (extract, transform, load) library and data integration toolbox for .NET built on top of Microsoft TPL.Dataflow library.

### Scheduling / GUI - other

*   [Occurify (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/Occurify/Occurify) - A powerful and intuitive .NET library for defining, filtering, transforming, and scheduling instant and period timelines.
*   [TickerQ (‚≠ê628)](https://github.com/Arcenox-co/TickerQ) - Lightweight, high-performance, reflection-free job scheduler for .NET with EF Core, cron/time-based execution, custom locking, and retry support.
items.content_html:
ETL

  • EtlBox.Classic (‚≠ê11) - Lightweight ETL (extract, transform, load) library and data integration toolbox for .NET built on top of Microsoft TPL.Dataflow library.

Scheduling / GUI - other

  • TickerQ (‚≠ê628) - Lightweight, high-performance, reflection-free job scheduler for .NET with EF Core, cron/time-based execution, custom locking, and retry support.

items.title: Awesome Games of Coding
items.content_text:
### Language Independent

*   [Codingame](https://www.codingame.com/home) - A platform to learn and compete. Proposes a variety of multiplayer games and contests as well as optimisation challenges and solo puzzles. You can contribute your own too. Choose your language, enjoy the graphics.
*   [RealTimeBattle](http://realtimebattle.sourceforge.net) - A programming game in which robots controlled by programs are fighting each other. The goal is to destroy the enemies, using the radar to examine the environment and the cannon to shoot.

### Miscellaneous

*   [SQL Murder Mystery](https://mystery.knightlab.com/) - The SQL Murder Mystery is designed to be both a self-directed lesson to learn SQL concepts and commands and a fun game for experienced SQL users to solve an intriguing crime.
*   [S3 Game](http://s3game-level1.s3-website.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/) - You are the treasure hunter. Your task is to get as many secret codes and open as many chests as possible.
*   [Learn Git Branching](https://learngitbranching.js.org/) - is the most visual and interactive way to learn Git on the web; where you'll be challenged with exciting levels.
items.content_html:
Language Independent

  • Codingame - A platform to learn and compete. Proposes a variety of multiplayer games and contests as well as optimisation challenges and solo puzzles. You can contribute your own too. Choose your language, enjoy the graphics.
  • RealTimeBattle - A programming game in which robots controlled by programs are fighting each other. The goal is to destroy the enemies, using the radar to examine the environment and the cannon to shoot.

Miscellaneous

  • SQL Murder Mystery - The SQL Murder Mystery is designed to be both a self-directed lesson to learn SQL concepts and commands and a fun game for experienced SQL users to solve an intriguing crime.
  • S3 Game - You are the treasure hunter. Your task is to get as many secret codes and open as many chests as possible.
  • Learn Git Branching - is the most visual and interactive way to learn Git on the web; where you'll be challenged with exciting levels.

items.title: Awesome Agi Cocosci
items.content_text:
### Domain Specific Language / Logic DSL Applications

*   [The KoLMogorov Test: Compression by Code Generation](https://openreview.net/forum?id=C45YqeBDUM) - ***ICLR'25***, 2025. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=16809888292456252135)]. Compression is at the heart of intelligence. A theoretically optimal way to compress any sequence of data is to find the shortest program that outputs that sequence and then halts. However, such Kolmogorov compression is uncomputable, and code generating LLMs struggle to approximate this theoretical ideal, as it requires reasoning, planning and search capabilities beyond those of current models. This work introduces the KoLMogorov-Test (KT), a compression-as-intelligence intelligence test for code generation LLMs. In KT a model is presented with a sequence of data at inference time, and asked to generate the shortest DSL (designed specifically for the task) program that produces the sequence. The authors identify several benefits of KT for both evaluation and training: an essentially infinite number of problem instances of varying difficulty is readily available, strong baselines already exist, the evaluation metric (compression) cannot be gamed, and pretraining data contamination is highly unlikely. To evaluate current models, the authors use audio, text, and DNA data, as well as sequences produced by random synthetic DSL programs.
items.content_html:
Domain Specific Language / Logic DSL Applications

  • The KoLMogorov Test: Compression by Code Generation - ICLR'25, 2025. [All Versions]. Compression is at the heart of intelligence. A theoretically optimal way to compress any sequence of data is to find the shortest program that outputs that sequence and then halts. However, such Kolmogorov compression is uncomputable, and code generating LLMs struggle to approximate this theoretical ideal, as it requires reasoning, planning and search capabilities beyond those of current models. This work introduces the KoLMogorov-Test (KT), a compression-as-intelligence intelligence test for code generation LLMs. In KT a model is presented with a sequence of data at inference time, and asked to generate the shortest DSL (designed specifically for the task) program that produces the sequence. The authors identify several benefits of KT for both evaluation and training: an essentially infinite number of problem instances of varying difficulty is readily available, strong baselines already exist, the evaluation metric (compression) cannot be gamed, and pretraining data contamination is highly unlikely. To evaluate current models, the authors use audio, text, and DNA data, as well as sequences produced by random synthetic DSL programs.

items.title: Awesome Postgres
items.content_text:
### Contents / High-Availability

*   [pgrwl (‚≠ê67)](https://github.com/hashmap-kz/pgrwl) - Stream write-ahead logs (WAL) from a PostgreSQL server in real time. A drop-in, container-friendly alternative to pg\_receivewal.

### Contents / Backups

*   [pg-backups-to-s3 (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/Saicheg/pg-backups-to-s3) - Docker-first solution on top of pg\_dump with support for environment-based configuration for scheduled PostgreSQL backups with optional compression, GPG encryption, webhooks, automatic upload to Amazon S3.

### Contents / Utilities

*   [flyway](https://flywaydb.org/) - Schema migration tool for Postgres and others.
*   [ScaffoldHub.io](https://scaffoldhub.io) - Generate fullstack PostgreSQL apps with Angular, Vue or React (Commercial Software).

### Resources / Blogs

*   [Digoal's PostgreSQL and Technical blog(Chinese Language) (‚≠ê8.3k)](https://github.com/digoal/blog/blob/master/README.md)
items.content_html:
Contents / High-Availability

  • pgrwl (‚≠ê67) - Stream write-ahead logs (WAL) from a PostgreSQL server in real time. A drop-in, container-friendly alternative to pg_receivewal.

Contents / Backups

  • pg-backups-to-s3 (‚≠ê17) - Docker-first solution on top of pg_dump with support for environment-based configuration for scheduled PostgreSQL backups with optional compression, GPG encryption, webhooks, automatic upload to Amazon S3.

Contents / Utilities

  • flyway - Schema migration tool for Postgres and others.
  • ScaffoldHub.io - Generate fullstack PostgreSQL apps with Angular, Vue or React (Commercial Software).

Resources / Blogs

  • Digoal's PostgreSQL and Technical blog(Chinese Language) (‚≠ê8.3k)

items.title: Free for Dev
items.content_text:
### Issue Tracking and Project Management

*   [kan.bn](https://kan.bn/) - A powerful, flexible kanban app that helps you organise work, track progress, and deliver results‚Äîall in one place. Free plan up to 1 user for unlimited boards, unlimited lists, unlimited cards.

items.title: Awesome Angular
items.content_text:

items.title: Awesome PICO 8
items.content_text:
### Contents / Libraries

*   [pico-test (‚≠ê44)](https://github.com/jozanza/pico-test) - PICO-8 testing framework.
*   [Lib-Pico8 (‚≠ê186)](https://github.com/clowerweb/Lib-Pico8) - A Pico-8 library of useful common functions.
*   [pico8-missing-builtins (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/adamscott/pico8-missing-builtins) - Provides Lua built-in functions to pico8.
*   [Pico-Kit (‚≠ê80)](https://github.com/outkine/pico-kit) - An opinionated collection of Pico-8 helpers that make it easier to get going.  Adds OOP, better debugging, and physics.
*   [PICO-Tween (‚≠ê86)](https://github.com/JoebRogers/PICO-Tween) - A small library of tweening/easing functions for use in the PICO-8 fantasy console, inspired by Robert Penner's easing functions.
items.content_html:
Contents / Libraries

  • pico-test (‚≠ê44) - PICO-8 testing framework.
  • Lib-Pico8 (‚≠ê186) - A Pico-8 library of useful common functions.
  • pico8-missing-builtins (‚≠ê26) - Provides Lua built-in functions to pico8.
  • Pico-Kit (‚≠ê80) - An opinionated collection of Pico-8 helpers that make it easier to get going. Adds OOP, better debugging, and physics.
  • PICO-Tween (‚≠ê86) - A small library of tweening/easing functions for use in the PICO-8 fantasy console, inspired by Robert Penner's easing functions.
